alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 11:50AM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Arizona, including the following county, Mohave. * WHEN...Until 130 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 AM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated isolated areas of moderate rain from Dolan Springs northeast into the Grand Wash Cliffs. It will continue east across an area. - Pierce Ferry Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of up to a 0.5 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Grand Canyon Ranch, Meadview, Dolan Springs, Grand Canyon Skywalk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
